item.title: Metals Rise as Gold Continues to Climb After Record Week
item.description: Base metals rose and gold climbed again on a fall in U.S. yields.

item.title: Jake Sullivan Navigates a World of Chaos
item.description: From weighing resigning over Afghanistan, to helping save Kyiv, President Biden’s national security adviser now faces his toughest test over Gaza.

item.title: Oil Mixed on Chinese Demand Concerns, U.S. Rate Cut Uncertainties
item.description: Oil prices hovered in early European trade on concerns over slowing demand in China and uncertainties around the timing of U.S. interest-rate cuts.

item.title: Tuesday's U.S. Inflation Data Could Halt Dollar's Decline
item.description: U.S. inflation data on Tuesday could halt the dollar’s recent falls, ING said, as the currency started the week steady after a sharp decline on Friday following the jobs data.

item.title: Portuguese Bonds Move in Line With Bunds After Sunday's Election
item.description: Portuguese government bonds moved in line with German Bunds early Monday after Sunday’s parliamentary election showing the country shifting to the right.

item.title: Saudi Aramco Hikes Dividend, Adjusts Spending
item.description: Saudi Arabia’s national oil company raised its dividend payouts for last year after it achieved its second-highest ever net profit and said investment plans to 2028 would be reduced by an abandoned plan to boost production.

item.title: Nikkei Falls 2.2%, Dragged by Tech, Auto Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks ended lower, dragged by falls in tech and auto stocks, as expectations persisted for the Bank of Japan’s possible shifts away from its ultralow interest-rate policy.

item.title: CATL Shares Rise After JV News, Morgan Stanley Upgrade
item.description: Contemporary Amperex Technology’s shares surged Monday on multiple drivers, including news of a collaboration with Chinese companies Xiaomi and BAIC Motor, as well as an upgrade by Morgan Stanley.

item.title: Dongfeng Motor Shares Slump After Profit Warning
item.description: Dongfeng Motor’s shares slumped after the Chinese automaker said it expects to swing to loss for 2023 amid intensifying competition.

item.title: It Isn't Just Big Tech Propelling Gains in the Stock Market Anymore
item.description: A broader group of companies has fueled the recent climb to records.

item.title: Legislation that would ban TikTok in the U.S. or force its sale is heading toward a vote in the House following months of behind-the-scenes efforts on Capitol Hill.
item.description: Legislation that would ban TikTok in the U.S. or force its sale is heading toward a vote in the House following months of behind-the-scenes efforts on Capitol Hill.

item.title: The Justice Department opened a criminal investigation into the Boeing 737 MAX blowout on an Alaska Airlines flight, according to documents and people familiar with the matter.
item.description: The Justice Department opened a criminal investigation into the Boeing 737 MAX blowout on an Alaska Airlines flight, according to documents and people familiar with the matter.

item.title: Two National Guard soldiers and a Border Patrol agent died in a helicopter crash near the U.S.-Mexico border in Texas, authorities said.
item.description: Two National Guard soldiers and a Border Patrol agent died in a helicopter crash near the U.S.-Mexico border in Texas, authorities said.

item.title: Robert Hur, the special counsel appointed to look into the Biden documents case, is expected to face intense grilling from lawmakers at a hearing on Tuesday.
item.description: Robert Hur, the special counsel appointed to look into the Biden documents case, is expected to face intense grilling from lawmakers at a hearing on Tuesday.

item.title: Nvidia, which has ridden the boom in artificial intelligence built largely on its chips, has also made itself into one of the world's hottest venture-capital investors.
item.description: Nvidia, which has ridden the boom in artificial intelligence built largely on its chips, has also made itself into one of the world’s hottest venture-capital investors.

item.title: Hamas leaders are betting that Ramadan can turn the momentum of the war in Gaza in their favor.
item.description: Hamas leaders are betting that Ramadan can turn the momentum of the war in Gaza in their favor.

item.title: Toll avoidance has jumped in parts of the U.S. since a broad shift to all-electronic tolling, costing government agencies millions of dollars.
item.description: Toll avoidance has jumped in parts of the U.S. since a broad shift to all-electronic tolling, costing government agencies millions of dollars.

item.title: U.S. officials are at odds over Biden's push to loosen restrictions on marijuana, a move some in the White House hope to see ahead of an election in which he needs the support of younger voters.
item.description: U.S. officials are at odds over Biden’s push to loosen restrictions on marijuana, a move some in the White House hope to see ahead of an election in which he needs the support of younger voters.

item.title: A photo of the Princess of Wales provided by the royal familywas retracted by news agencies after the AP said it appeared to have been manipulated.
item.description: A photo of the Princess of Wales provided by the royal family was retracted by news agencies after the AP said it appeared to have been manipulated.

item.title: The Republican leadership has been cool in its response to Rep. Anna Paulina Luna's proposal to allow House members who give birth to vote by proxy for six weeks.
item.description: The Republican leadership has been cool in its response to Rep. Anna Paulina Luna’s proposal to allow House members who give birth to vote by proxy for six weeks.
